catalog_info.description: This course focuses of the cultural history of the common state of the South Slavs from its founding in 1919 until its bloody dissolution in 1991.  Students will be asked to engage with verbal and visual texts produced during this period in order to gain a better understanding of how the national imaginary is created, sustained and destroyed.  Some of the writers featured are AndriÄ, KrleÅ¾a and SelimoviÄ, some of the filmmakers are Makavejev, Kusturica and Manchevski.  Readings will be available both in the original Bosnian/Croatian/Serbian and in the English translation.  The focus of the course is on the interaction between politics and culture in representing conflict.
